column4: General Motors grapples with safety crisis
column5: General Motors Co is grappling with a crisis over its 11-year failure to recall cars equipped with faulty ignition switches. The flaw could cause engines to shut off  leading to a sudden loss of power steering and power brakes  and the failure of air bags to deploy in a crash. So far  GM has attributed at least 54 crashes and 13 deaths to switch-related air bag malfunctions. It was only in February of this year that GM finally began recalling 2.6 million Chevrolet Cobalts  Saturn Ions and other

column4: TIMELINE-General Motors grapples with safety crisis
column5: General Motors Co is grappling with a crisis over its 11-year failure to recall cars equipped with faulty ignition switches. The flaw could cause engines to shut off  leading to a sudden loss of power steering and power brakes  and the failure of air bags to deploy in a crash. So far  GM has attributed at least 54 crashes and 13 deaths to switch-related air bag malfunctions. It was only in February of this year that GM finally began recalling 2.6 million Chevrolet Cobalts  Saturn Ions and other

column5: LONDON  June 17 Lloyds Banking Group  has narrowed the price range for its stock market listing of TSB Banking Group  to between 250 pence and 270 pence  sources familiar with the matter told Reuters on Tuesday.

column4: Boeing-Lockheed venture eyes alternate rocket engine by 2019
column5: WASHINGTON The rocket launch company run by Boeing Co and Lockheed Martin Corp on Monday said it had signed contracts with multiple U.S. firms to work on a next-generation rocket engine as an alternative to a Russian engine now used for key launches.

column4: McCain questions 'cronyism' on Lockheed F-35 program
column5: WASHINGTON Republican Senator John McCain on Monday said he was concerned by recent revelations of U.S. government-industry "cronyism" in developing Lockheed Martin Corp's F-35 fighter jet  and said the $398.6 billion program still had "major problems."

column4: Stanley Marsh 3  founder of Cadillac Ranch in Texas  dead at 76
column5: AUSTIN Texas Stanley Marsh 3  who rose to prominence for his whimsical Cadillac Ranch art installation in the Texas Panhandle and whose latter years were tainted by accusations of sexually abusing children  has died at the age of 76  his lawyer said on Tuesday.    Marsh was an oil multi-millionaire and known throughout Texas for quirky feats such as building what he said was the world's biggest pool table in a cow pasture on the Texas plains. Marsh had been in failing health and died

column5: WASHINGTON The U.S. Senate's chief tax law writer on Tuesday vowed to work on overhauling the federal tax code by August 2015  citing a move by Medtronic Inc to shift its tax home base to Ireland as a spur to congressional action.

column4: Och-Ziff  others buying $3.8bln CITIC Pacific stake to boost free float

column5: MOSCOW Norway's Statoil could increase gas supplies to the European Union but would not be able to replace Russian gas  CEO Helge Lund said on Tuesday  a day after Moscow cut off supplies to Ukraine over a price dispute.

column4: UPS to charge by size for U.S. ground packages
column5: June 17 United Parcel Service Inc  the world's biggest package delivery company  said it will start charging by size of packages for all ground services in the United States  as it looks to offset rising fuel costs.

column4: Exclusive: U.S. steel industry may challenge Russian trade deal - sources
column5: WASHINGTON/NEW YORK The U.S. steel industry is considering challenging a trade deal with Russia that governs imports of hot-rolled steel  potentially reviving a decades-old dispute amid mounting tensions over Russia's actions in Ukraine  two sources said.

column4: Universal to unveil second Harry Potter attraction
column5: ORLANDO Fla. Universal Orlando kicks off previews on Wednesday of its much anticipated Diagon Alley  a second Harry Potter-themed attraction that is expected provide a boost for the park's revenues and for tourism in central Florida.

column4: Valeant goes hostile  to launch Allergan exchange offer this week
column5: Valeant Pharmaceuticals Inc  said on Tuesday it will launch an exchange offer for Allergan Inc  this week  allowing it to eventually take the unsolicited bid directly to shareholders.

column4: Wal-Mart China to raise food safety spending to $48 million
column5: BEIJING The world's biggest retailer  Wal-Mart Stores Inc  said on Tuesday that it will increase its spending on food safety in China to 300 million yuan ($48.32 million) in 2013  2014 and 2015  up from a previously-announced 100 million yuan in the same period.
